intro: Galium pseudocinereum, commonly known as silverweed or false silverweed, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale blue flowers in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium pseudocinereum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
